other_tests.findings: Pathological examination revealed trilineage hematopoiesis with normal morphologic features; a small, clonal B-cell population (3% of B cells expressing CD19+ CD20+ CD5− CD10− kappa+) was detected.
A cryoprecipitate with a cryocrit of 3% was detected.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The cryocrit increased to 8% two months later and was undetectable after six cycles of bortezomib.

other_tests.findings: Glomeruli showed lobular architecture with increased mesangial cellularity; pseudothrombi were present, consistent with cryoglobulinemic glomerulonephritis.
Performed due to rising creatinine level amidst the clinical presentation of cryoglobulinemia.
